title: Basics of Floristry
headline: This free online floristry course will teach you how to launch and manage a successful flower business.
description: ‘Floristry’ is the cultivation and trade of flowers. What are the responsibilities of florists? How do they handle commercial accounts? This course answers such questions and explores the styles of floristry. We examine the anatomy of plants to explain flower care and treatment before comparing various seasonal flowers. Enrol to acquire the botanical and business skills you need to turn your love of flowers into a thriving florist shop.
courseDescription:
The cultivation, marketing and trade of flowers is collectively referred to as ‘floristry’, which includes the care and handling of flowers, floral design and arrangement, retailing, production, display and flower delivery. We begin this course by studying the anatomy of plants as such botanical knowledge is important to keeping flowers alive and healthy. In addition, we describe the dangerous effects of the plant hormone ethylene and demonstrate the benefits of understanding the specific requirements of each plant in your care.

The course then explores the elements of floral designs, including the symbolism attached to the colour of flowers used in floral arrangements. We explain how your creativity can be harnessed to create beautiful arrangements and break down the components of wedding floristry. Finally, the course provides the tools you need to start your floristry shop and lays out the steps you should take to launch your floristry business successfully.

This course covers the fundamental concepts of floristry. We provide practical techniques and insider tips you can use to confidently start your own business. From caring for living things to dealing with clients, this course explores the everyday life of a florist and suits anyone who wants to turn their eye for beauty and passion for flowers into a career.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital : a downloadable in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • : a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked , posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed : a physical version of your officially branded and security marked in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

  • Introduction to Floristry - Lesson Summary

  • Below you will find key information covered in this module:
    • The minimal education necessary to become a florist is a high school diploma or GED. Consider enrolling in biology and art classes at school to learn about plants and how to arrange them properly. 
    • Those wishing to create a flower shop might also benefit from taking business and economics courses, as they can learn how to be successful company owners.
    • Some firms seeking to hire future florists initially hire high school graduates and give on-the-job training. Try to practise as much as possible and familiarise yourself with the tools required to create arrangements during this period. 
    • Consider an apprenticeship with a mentor to gain access to their knowledge and skills. You might also seek employment in a local floral or grocery store.
    • In addition to learning how to prepare flowers, you should consider gaining skills that aid a florist in doing their duties properly. These are some important qualities florists should possess:
    • Florists frequently utilise creative approaches to produce visually beautiful flower creations for various occasions and to offer consumers with novel concepts.
    • Florists communicate and develop relationships with prospective clients by communicating their designs and ideas. This demands effective communication abilities to convey complicated topics to someone unfamiliar with floral principles.

    • Describe making funeral flower arrangements.
    • Recognise some of the most popular floral designs.
    • Explain how to start your own floristry business.

  • Floral Events - Lesson Summary

  • Below you will find key information covered in this module:
    • Consider joining the AIFD or a floral organisation in your state in order to network with other floristry industry experts. Joining these clubs might help you uncover employment prospects since their websites frequently have job boards with advertisements for floral careers.
    • Consider both short-term and long-term objectives when pursuing a career as a florist. If operating a flower store is your ultimate objective, start investigating the company's startup and branding processes. 
    • However, if you want to produce bouquets from home for weddings and other events, you should consider promoting your services to others in your community who can assist spread word of mouth.
    • Once you've focused, on your distinctive design style, you'll need to use it to identify your niche or ideal customer. For instance: If you enjoy producing minimalist wedding flower arrangements, so should your target market!
    • Utilize your enthusiasm for aiding budget brides and your ability to stretch a dollar to support budget brides in your neighbourhood.
    • If you wish to sell hand-tied bouquets of local flowers at farmers' markets, you may have found your niche! And if you're all about meeting clients where they are, a flower truck or pop-up floral store may be your best option.
    • Flowers help us celebrate significant events in our lives (like weddings, birthdays, and anniversaries). 
    • However, studies have shown that the presence of fresh flowers may stimulate our creativity and excitement, raise our sentiments of compassion, and decrease our worry and despair.
